item.title: Constant dangerous parking - still delivery trucks, 31st July
item.description:
As reported previously delivery trucks double park at Hebden St / Whiston Rd crossing, leaving NO visibility for local residents, pedestrians and cyclists. This is a fatality waiting - Zebra crossing or officer needed ASAP!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Jeger Avenue, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant illegal parking on Edge Hill Avenue, 31st July
item.description:
Cars and vans are constantly parking on the double yellow lines on edge hill avenue. I worked tirelessly for 2 years getting the council to put these lines in for safety reasons, only to recently learn that they can’t yet issue parking tickets. Cars swing round the corner and pedestrians can’t even walk on the pavement due to cars/ vans blocking the pavement (they have to walk out into the road!). Sort this out Barnet council!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edge Hill Avenue, Temple Fortune, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely overgrown vegetation, 31st July
item.description:
Quay Road bus stop, right across the road from Met Police. Vegetation has been growing for over 3 years now, all previous complaints have been disregarded. Bus cannot be seen coming unless one leans onto the road, which is a hazard. Waiting at the bus stop to the back only gets the passengers to miss the bus as the driver wouldn't stop, because it's too late by the time we hail the bus, as it's moving too quick. Clearing up this vegetation, would not only provide a view, but also help us not to have to lean onto the road. TfL has informed it is not under their authority as the road is a borough road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Circular Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Design flaw, 31st July
item.description:
Hi i see this has already been reported. That's good. However, please can you pass on that whenever turning or parking near these new bollards, they disappear from the driver's view when a metre or so away. It's a very poor design. thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manor Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unloved raised bed, 31st July
item.description:
This has been basically abandoned since the council housing building was sold for flats. It is full of litter and is basically one big weed. It needs completely replanting with something to look nice since this part of Southampton way is having hundreds of new flats built.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree with Dead Branches Needs Investigating/Pruning, 31st July
item.description:
This tree had a small part of a branch fall off a couple of months ago in the high wind and having looked up at it today, there seems to be a number of dead branches with no growth. It may need pruning or investigating to check the tree is not diseased.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsdown Way, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large fallen tree branch and debris on The Green, 31st July
item.description:
There is a very large tree branch fallen down on The Green together with some smaller branches nearby. Also, the ARISINGS for the very large tree opposite numbers 22, 20, and 18 are now so large the cars are having to navigate to the centre of the road to go around them. Please can they be dealt with as soon as possible.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, The Green, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
